title: How to Make Asian Eyes Look Bigger

steps.title: Yes, eyelid adhesive can make hooded eyes look bigger.
steps.content: Yes, eyelid adhesive can make hooded eyes look bigger. To use eyelid adhesive, wash your eyelids and pat them dry with a towel. If you’re using tape, cut out a thin strip and press it against your upper eyelid along the crease you’d like to enhance. If you’re using eyelid glue, brush a small amount onto your crease and let it dry for about a minute. [1] X Research source The higher you place your adhesive, the bigger your lid will look. It can take some trial and error, so be prepared to take it off and redo it a few times. Both the tape and the glue are clear, so they shouldn’t be too noticeable in your everyday life. However, sweat and oil can make them come off, so you may have to reapply throughout the day.

steps.title: Contour your eye crease with brown eyeshadow.
steps.content: Contour your eye crease with brown eyeshadow. Pick a shade that’s only 1 to 2 shades darker than your natural skin. Using a fluffy brush, gently pat the shade into your crease, or the area just above your eyelid. Blend it out to make your eyes look bigger and deeper without a ton of effort. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add a deep brown color along your upper lash line.
steps.content: Add a deep brown color along your upper lash line. Use a cotton swab or a small makeup brush to pick up a deep brown eyeshadow. Apply the eyeshadow by dragging it across your upper lash line, focusing on the outer half of your eye. Try to drag the color just outside of your eye to lengthen and elongate your overall eye shape. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use dark brown eyeshadow underneath the center of your eye.
steps.content: Use dark brown eyeshadow underneath the center of your eye. Use a fluffy eyeshadow brush to gently pick up a brown shade that’s 1 to 2 shades darker than your skin. Pat it directly underneath your lower lash line, focusing it in the center of your eye. Blend it out just slightly to keep your look natural while making your eye look rounder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add white eyeliner to your water line.
steps.content: Add white eyeliner to your water line. Grab a white eyeliner pencil and gently pull your lower eyelid down. Gently dab the eyeliner onto your water line, or the area just above your lower lashes. This is a tricky makeup hack to get used to, but it can really make your eyes pop in a photo. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use black eyeliner on the outer half of your eye.
steps.content: Use black eyeliner on the outer half of your eye. Grab an eyeliner pen or pencil and start from the center of your eye. Apply the eyeliner gently, going from the middle of your eye to the outer corner. Make the eyeliner line fairly thick, but don’t add a wing to the end. Instead, follow your natural eye shape to open up your eyes and make them look rounder. [6] X Expert Source Luca Buzas Makeup Artist & Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 21 June 2019. Opt for a waterproof eyeliner so the makeup doesn’t transfer onto your eyelid throughout the day. [7] X Expert Source Joseph Harwood Beauty, DEI & Social Media Expert Expert Interview. 16 March 2022.

steps.title: Curl your lashes and brush on a coat of mascara for an easy option.
steps.content: Curl your lashes and brush on a coat of mascara for an easy option. Use an eyelash curler to gently curl your eyelashes and make them look longer. Then, apply a thin layer of your favorite mascara on your upper and lower lashes to lengthen them even more. Focus the mascara on the outer half of your eye to extend your eye shape and make it look rounder. [8] X Expert Source Luca Buzas Makeup Artist & Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 21 June 2019. Go with a waterproof mascara, so your gorgeous look lasts all day long. [9] X Expert Source Joseph Harwood Beauty, DEI & Social Media Expert Expert Interview. 16 March 2022.

steps.title: Apply natural-looking fake lashes for more dramatic results.
steps.content: Apply natural-looking fake lashes for more dramatic results. Pick out a pair of lashes that are just slightly longer than your natural ones. Put a thin line of glue on the lashes and press them on top of your lash line to make your eyes look bigger. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wear circle lenses.
steps.content: Wear circle lenses. Pick out contacts that have irises slightly larger than your natural ones. The circular shape will help to elongate your eyes and make them look bigger, especially if you go for all black ones. Make sure you buy contacts from a reputable optometrist to avoid doing any damage to your eyes. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Yes, black eyeliner can make your eyes look smaller.
steps.content: Yes, black eyeliner can make your eyes look smaller. Instead, try using white eyeliner on your lash line or a subtle brown underneath your lashes to make your eyes look bigger. Stick to using black eyeliner on your upper lid to lengthen and elongate your eye shape. [12] X Research source If you really want to use black eyeliner on your lower lash line, stick to the outer corner of your eye. That way, you’ll drag your eye shape outwards to make it look longer.
